page.title: 17PRINCES RISBOROUGH FAIR
page.content: A charter granted by King Henry VIII gave Princes Risborough a fair and also a weekly market both of which remain. The day of the market has changed over the years from Wednesday to Saturday, but still occupies the Market Square in the centre of town. The Fair comes to Princes Risborough twice a year. The Fair dutes have changed over the centuries to May 6th and October 21st. The Fair is only allowed to operate in Princes Risborough for three days and is allowed to come in one day before. The Fair usually causes a lot of traffic problems because they are entitled to occupy the Market Square. The Fair in Princes Risborough is really only Suitable for children from four to fourteen years old. The Fair consists of a big wheel, round about, twisters, dodgems, trains and stalls.
